ca.polymtl.inf3995.oronos.widgets.views

Class FindMe

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.ViewGroup
        • android.widget.LinearLayout
          • ca.polymtl.inf3995.oronos.widgets.views.OronosView
            • ca.polymtl.inf3995.oronos.widgets.views.FindMe
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.hardware.SensorEventListener, android.location.LocationListener, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewManager, android.view.ViewParent, DataDispatcher.CANDataListener, ContainableWidget

    public class FindMe
extends OronosView
implements android.hardware.SensorEventListener, android.location.LocationListener, DataDispatcher.CANDataListener

    Find Me

    This class is responsible of displaying a 3D arrow that is pointing towards the rocket considering its GPS position.
    Since:
    2018-04-12
    Version:
    0.0
    Author:
    FÃ©lix Boulet

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void buildView()
      View builder method.
      private void enableLocationUpdates()
      This method enables location updates if a location manager is available.
      protected void finalize()
      private void flushWebGLRenderer()
      This method loads a blank page into the WebView to save on resources.
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> getCANSidList()
      Accessor for the CAN sid list.
      static java.util.Set<FindMe> getInstances()
      Accessor for the find me instance.
      float getRotationMatrixElement(int i)
      This method is used by the WebView (threeView) to get the rotation matrix (4x4) for rendering.
      java.lang.String getSerialNumber()
      Accessor for the emitting pcb serial number.
      java.lang.String getSourceModule()
      Accessor for the emitting pcb name.
      float getUnitVectorElement(int i)
      This method is used by the WebView (threeView) to get the location unit vector for rendering.
      void grantPermissions()
      This method enables sensor and location updates once permissions are granted.
      void onAccuracyChanged(android.hardware.Sensor sensor, int i)
      Unused method that would be called when sensor accuracy has changed.
      protected void onAttachedToWindow()
      This method is called when the FindMe widget becomes visible on screen (usually when the user selects a container page (TabContainer, DualWidget, ...) that has a FindMe widget in it.
      void onCANDataReceived(BroadcastMessage msg)
      This method is taking care of the reception of a broadcast message.
      protected void onDetachedFromWindow()
      This method is called when the FindMe widget gets off screen (app is closed, displayed view container changes, ...).
      void onLocationChanged(android.location.Location location)
      This method is called when the device's location has changed.
      void onProviderDisabled(java.lang.String provider)
      Unused method that would be called when a provider is disabled.
      void onProviderEnabled(java.lang.String provider)
      Unused method that would be called when a provider is enabled.
      void onSensorChanged(android.hardware.SensorEvent sensorEvent)
      This method is called when a sensor (accelerometer or magnetometer) has acquired new data.
      void onStatusChanged(java.lang.String provider, int status, android.os.Bundle extras)
      Unused method that would be called if a provider (GPS or network) becomes unavailable or erratic.
      private void register() 
      private void registerSensors()
      This method registers FindMe as the listener for the accelerometer and magnetometer sensors.
      private void setupWebGLRenderer()
      This method loads the Javascript Three.js renderer, which starts itself, into the WebView.
      void showPermissionWarning()
      This method is called from the MainActivity listener to display the warning snackbar if permissions are not enabled.
      private void startLocationTask()
      This method is called when the find me view is reactivated.
      private void startSensorTask()
      This method starts a fixed-rate task as a daemon (meaning it will be killed if the app is closed) to update sensor data at a specific frequency (every 200 milliseconds).
      private void stopLocationTask()
      This method stops the task started by the method above.
      private void stopLocationUpdates()
      This method removes FindMe as the listener for location updates, effectively disabling them.
      private void stopSensorTask()
      This method stops the task started by the method above.
      private void unregister() 
      private void unregisterSensors()
      This method unregisters FindMe as the listener for the sensors.
      private void updateLocation()
      This method updates the location unit vector from the device's location to the rocket's location.
      private void updateOrientationAngles()
      This method updates the device's rotation matrix from sensor data.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FindMe

        public FindMe(android.content.Context context)
        FindMe widget constructor. Initializes fields then calls the view builder method.
        Parameters:
        context - The application context.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstances

        public static java.util.Set<FindMe> getInstances()
        Accessor for the find me instance.

      • finalize

        protected void finalize()
                 throws java.lang.Throwable
        Overrides:
        finalize in class java.lang.Object
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable

      • buildView

        private void buildView()
        View builder method. This method sets layout parameters for the views contained in the widget, including the various containers, the WebView for displaying the arrow and the coordinator for the snackbar.

      • setupWebGLRenderer

        private void setupWebGLRenderer()
        This method loads the Javascript Three.js renderer, which starts itself, into the WebView. It should only be called when the FindMe view is visible (onAttachedToWindow) to save on CPU/GPU resources.

      • flushWebGLRenderer

        private void flushWebGLRenderer()
        This method loads a blank page into the WebView to save on resources. Should be called when first building the view and when the FindMe view is invisible (onDetachedFromWindow).

      • onAttachedToWindow

        protected void onAttachedToWindow()
        This method is called when the FindMe widget becomes visible on screen (usually when the user selects a container page (TabContainer, DualWidget, ...) that has a FindMe widget in it. It checks if the app has location permissions, which are needed for the widget to work. If not, a persistent snackbar is made to inform the user that they need to enable them. When pressed, the button on the snackbar will open a permission dialog to ask for permissions. The listener for this action is implemented in MainActivity. Otherwise, if the app has permissions, grantPermissions is called.
        Overrides:
        onAttachedToWindow in class android.view.ViewGroup

      • onDetachedFromWindow

        protected void onDetachedFromWindow()
        This method is called when the FindMe widget gets off screen (app is closed, displayed view container changes, ...). It stops sensor related updates, location updates, and removes the 3D renderer from the view.
        Overrides:
        onDetachedFromWindow in class android.view.ViewGroup

      • startLocationTask

        private void startLocationTask()
        This method is called when the find me view is reactivated.

      • stopLocationTask

        private void stopLocationTask()
        This method stops the task started by the method above.

      • startSensorTask

        private void startSensorTask()
        This method starts a fixed-rate task as a daemon (meaning it will be killed if the app is closed) to update sensor data at a specific frequency (every 200 milliseconds).

      • stopSensorTask

        private void stopSensorTask()
        This method stops the task started by the method above.

      • grantPermissions

        public void grantPermissions()
        This method enables sensor and location updates once permissions are granted. It creates a locationManager using the appropriate system service, then registers sensors with the FindMe itself as a listener. It also sets up the 3D renderer. This method can be called from the MainActivity in the permission listener 'onRequestPermissionsResult'.

      • showPermissionWarning

        public void showPermissionWarning()
        This method is called from the MainActivity listener to display the warning snackbar if permissions are not enabled.

      • registerSensors

        private void registerSensors()
        This method registers FindMe as the listener for the accelerometer and magnetometer sensors.

      • unregisterSensors

        private void unregisterSensors()
        This method unregisters FindMe as the listener for the sensors.

      • enableLocationUpdates

        private void enableLocationUpdates()
        This method enables location updates if a location manager is available. It requests updates from both the GPS and network, which will be handled by the onLocationChanged listener. It also tries getting the last known location of the device, if available.

      • stopLocationUpdates

        private void stopLocationUpdates()
        This method removes FindMe as the listener for location updates, effectively disabling them.

      • register

        private void register()

      • unregister

        private void unregister()

      • updateOrientationAngles

        private void updateOrientationAngles()
        This method updates the device's rotation matrix from sensor data.

      • updateLocation

        private void updateLocation()
        This method updates the location unit vector from the device's location to the rocket's location.

      • onSensorChanged

        public void onSensorChanged(android.hardware.SensorEvent sensorEvent)
        This method is called when a sensor (accelerometer or magnetometer) has acquired new data. It places the values from the event into arrays for later processing.
        Specified by:
        onSensorChanged in interface android.hardware.SensorEventListener
        Parameters:
        sensorEvent - The sensor event emitted by the sensor.

      • onAccuracyChanged

        public void onAccuracyChanged(android.hardware.Sensor sensor,
                              int i)
        Unused method that would be called when sensor accuracy has changed.
        Specified by:
        onAccuracyChanged in interface android.hardware.SensorEventListener
        Parameters:
        sensor - The affected sensor.
        i - The new accuracy of the sensor.

      • onLocationChanged

        public void onLocationChanged(android.location.Location location)
        This method is called when the device's location has changed.
        Specified by:
        onLocationChanged in interface android.location.LocationListener
        Parameters:
        location - The new location provided by the GPS or network.

      • onStatusChanged

        public void onStatusChanged(java.lang.String provider,
                            int status,
                            android.os.Bundle extras)
        Unused method that would be called if a provider (GPS or network) becomes unavailable or erratic. Since we already have a listener for the two providers, this has no real use.
        Specified by:
        onStatusChanged in interface android.location.LocationListener
        Parameters:
        provider - The affected provider.
        status - The status of the provider.
        extras - Extra data.

      • onProviderEnabled

        Specified by:
        onProviderEnabled in interface android.location.LocationListener
        Parameters:
        provider - The provider in question.

      • onProviderDisabled

        Unused method that would be called when a provider is disabled.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

      • getUnitVectorElement

        public float getUnitVectorElement(int i)
        This method is used by the WebView (threeView) to get the location unit vector for rendering. It is only called from Javascript.
        Parameters:
        i - The index of the wanted element in the unitDistance array.
        Returns:
        The element in question.

      • getRotationMatrixElement

        public float getRotationMatrixElement(int i)
        This method is used by the WebView (threeView) to get the rotation matrix (4x4) for rendering. It is only called from Javascript.
        Parameters:
        i - The index of the wanted element in the rotationMatrix array.
        Returns:
        The element in question.

      • onCANDataReceived

        public void onCANDataReceived(BroadcastMessage msg)
        This method is taking care of the reception of a broadcast message. It updates the rocket information based on the CAN sid.
        Specified by:
        onCANDataReceived in interface DataDispatcher.CANDataListener
        Parameters:
        msg - the broadcast message (either GPS latitude, longitude or altitude info).
